ygData.subject: RE: Guise of the Deceiver
ygData.msgSnippet: I can confirm your #2 supposition.  I wear my mask (old style mask) for the cha stats.  I stop songs and right click on the mask in it s face inv slot to cast
ygData.messageBody:
I can confirm your #2 supposition. I wear my mask (old style mask) for the
cha stats. I stop songs and right click on the mask in it's face inv slot
to cast the spell. I get "you feel like you are about to look like
yourself..." or some such warnings when the spell is about to wear off. Zone
and I need to recast. I am still KOS in Nek. I can sell to the Oger vendor
with it on (illusion cast) but not otherwise (even though I have killed
loads of Bouncers - or been in partys that have I should say.) The Oger
guards are KOS to me on or off - I think - would have to test that.

Sylly

p.s. although I have not yet binded in Ogg - I do camp there.

Subject: [eqbards] Guise of the Deceiver

From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4"
<g4mntofcr@...>

How eactly does the DE illusion work now that you have to
equip the Guise?
I see two options:
1) When wearing the mask, you get the stat bonuses all the
time plus the DE
illusion goes up as soon as you put it on. DE illusion
remains in effect
all the time as long as you are wearing mask.

2) When wearing the mask, you get the stat bonuses all the
time but DE
illusion is not active. Click on mask icon to activate the
illusion.
Illusion remains in effect for a certain duration. Duration
wears off when
zoning.

Based on everything I've read, I think #2 is how it works
but would just
like confirmation.

Galtin of E'ci

> Response to many messages with this one.
>
> 1. New drop is Mask of Deception. Exact same stats as
the Guise (4ac
> 13cha
> 7mr NO DROP yadda yadda) Only new thing is that it must be
equipped to
> trigger the Illusion: Dark Elf effect.
>
> 2. Someone mentioned about big ogres and trolls
blocking hallways and
> that
> the Guise is perfect for taking care of this. From a
utility standpoint,
> yes
> that is true, but that is about all there is to it. There
is really no
> sense
> of why the Guise is used.
>
> 3. The RP sense of it all. I know I'd raise my hand
first when I say
> that I
> don't really consider what race a char is when I group
with them. I did
> when
> I was level 6 but now it gets difficult to pick and choose
who to group
> with. If this were not the case and many people RP'd
racial reactions in
> groups I'd imagine that there would be a lot fewer dyed
DE's and the ones
> you'd mostly see would be naturals. (Although the female
DE form is rather
> a
> pleasant sight };)
>
> 4. Ever think of why a froglok assasin would have an
item that would
> change
> them into a DE? The frogs are natural enemies to the
Trolls and Ogres
> (possibly the DE's too not sure). Mayhaps there was some
subterranean plot
> afoot to strike against the Tier'Dal horde or evil races
in general before
> the frogs died? (This sorta falls apart if you consider
the undead frogs
> as
> plotting against the evil races since they attack
everyone...)
>
> 5. Personally I'd prefer the thing to have the effect
for as long as
> you
> have it on (not just from an annoying 'damn-the
> effect-wore-off-gotta-right-click-it-again'). If you want
to be a DE then
> you'd slip the Mask on and the magic of it would change
your form. Mostly
> similar to what happens in the movie 'The Mask'.
Unfortunately the engine
> can't seem to handle the illusion effect across zones(?)
>
> Good Journey
>
> Sineras Silverlyre, The Divine Alliance
(Cazic-Thule)
